============================
Stock Picking Show Backorder
============================

.. !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

   !! changes will be overwritten.                   !!
   !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

.. |badge4| image:: https://img.shields.io/badge/weblate-Translate%20me-F47D42.png

|badge1| |badge2| |badge3| |badge4| |badge5| 

This module provide a new field on stock pickings, allowing to see the
backorders associated to a picking.

**Table of contents**

.. contents::
   :local:

Usage
=====

To use this module, you need to:

#. Go to 'Inventory' and create a picking.
#. Edit the 'Done' quantity of some operation line to be less than the 'To
   Do' quantity.
#. Save, validate and 'Create Backorder'.
#. A new page in the notebook has appeared with a list of the picking that
   are backorders of this picking.

Bug Tracker
===========

Bugs are tracked on `GitHub Issues <https://github.com/OCA/stock-logistics-workflow/issues>`_.
In case of trouble, please check there if your issue has already been reported.
If you spotted it first, help us smashing it by providing a detailed and welcomed
`feedback <https://github.com/OCA/stock-logistics-workflow/issues/new?body=module:%20stock_picking_show_backorder%0Aversion:%2012.0%0A%0A**Steps%20to%20reproduce**%0A-%20...%0A%0A**Current%20behavior**%0A%0A**Expected%20behavior**>`_.

Do not contact contributors directly about support or help with technical issues.

info.html_description:
This module provide a new field on stock pickings, allowing to see the backorders associated to a picking.

Table of contents

  • Usage
  • Bug Tracker
  • Credits
    • Authors
    • Contributors
    • Maintainers

Usage

To use this module, you need to:

  1. Go to ‘Inventory’ and create a picking.
  2. Edit the ‘Done’ quantity of some operation line to be less than the ‘To Do’ quantity.
  3. Save, validate and ‘Create Backorder’.
  4. A new page in the notebook has appeared with a list of the picking that are backorders of this picking.

Bug Tracker

Bugs are tracked on GitHub Issues. In case of trouble, please check there if your issue has already been reported. If you spotted it first, help us smashing it by providing a detailed and welcomed feedback.

Do not contact contributors directly about support or help with technical issues.
